text: A group of closely related organisms capable of interbreeding to produce fertile offspring are known as members of a
Viruses are economically important because they?

options.B: can only reproduce inside living cells.
options.C: cause diseases in plants and animals
options.D: exist as crystals outside living cells

explanation:
Plant viruses are of considerable economic importance because many of them infect crop and ornamental plants.
Numerous plant viruses are rodlike and can be extracted readily from plant tissue and crystallized.
Animal viruses of economic importance: Genetic variation, persistence, and prospects for their control.

text: After an hour, the level of  water in the thistle funnel will
The experiment above is used to demonstrate the process of
In plant cells the role of the membrane is played by the
Red blood cells were found to have burst open after being placed in distilled water for an hour. This phenomenon is known as
The curvature movement of plants in response to the stimulus of water is called
Two organelles directly involved in mitotic cell division are
explanation:
Two key organelles directly involved in mitotic cell division are the centrosome (which contains centrioles) and the nucleus. The centrosome, with its centrioles, helps organize the mitotic spindle, while the nucleus houses and organizes the genetic material (chromosomes) during the division process.
Centrioles are cylindrical structures found in animal cells and are essential for cell division. They organize the mitotic spindle, a structure that ensures accurate chromosome separation during mitosis.

text: A group of rats placed in an air-tight box for some hours died because they
explanation: Rats, like all mammals, require oxygen to survive. They breathe in oxygen and breathe out carbon dioxide, a process known as respiration. In an air-tight box, the available oxygen would eventually be used up, and the rats would die from lack of oxygen, not from the presence of carbon dioxide or nitrogen, or from running out of energy.

Which of the statements below is valid?

options.A: The bird’s blood was always warmer than that of the lizard
options.B: The body temperature of the bird varied less than that of the lizard during changes in environmental temperature
options.C: The body temperature of the bird remained constant despite changes in environmental temperature
options.D: The body temperature of the lizard was always close to that of the environmental temperature

explanation: From the graph of the body temperature of a lizard and a bird under artificial conditions. It can deduced that;* Lizard- It is a poikilothermic organism- Its body temperature varies with the temperature of the environment- The lizard needs to change to the environment temperature so that it can survive.* Bird- It is a homothermic organism- Its body temperature is always constant to the environment- The environment temperature those not affect the temperature of the body of the bird

text: Pepsin is secreted as an inactive precursor called pepsinogen because

options.A: pepsin as an enzyme is quickly destroyed by the alkaline food from the mouth
options.B: all digestive enzymes pass through a precursor stage
options.C: pepsin is a proteolytic enzyme and might attack the stomach tissues
options.D: pepsin is not required in large quantities

explanation:
Pepsin is secreted as an inactive precursor, called pepsinogen to prevent it from digesting the cells and tissues that produce it.
By secreting pepsinogen, the stomach can control the activation of pepsin which usually occurs whenever pepsinogen comes in contact with Hydrochloric acid in the stomach. The acid environment triggers a conformational change in pepsinogen,allowing it to convert into pepsin.
This mechanism ensures that pepsin is only activated when it is needed. i.e Whenever food is ingested through the mouth and gets into the stomach, and helps protect the stomach lining and other tissues from damage.

text: In ecological succession, since Iichens grow on bare rock, they are considered to be
Which of the following factors will most likely lead to overcrowding within a population?

Which of the following practices does not contribute to the preservation and improvement of the environment?
Variation is important in human life and can be used for the following activities except
explanation:
Human variation focuses on individual differences such as height, weight, skin colour etc whereas population distribution examines the aggregate character of a group such as population size, density and distribution.
Consequently, it finds application in crime detection, blood transfusion, and determination of paternity.

A man who is heterozygous for the disease haemophilia marries a woman who is double recessive for haemophilia. What percentage of their offspring would have the disease?
A dairy farmer allowed only his best milk producing cows to mate. In succeeding generations of cows: milk production increased. This outcome is an example of
Cytokinesis of mitosis is a process that ensures that

options.A: each daughter cells gets the necessary organelles
options.B: there is distribution of a complete set of genes into each daughter cell
options.C: daughter cells inherit new genetic combinations.
options.D: worn out organelles are excluded from daughter cells

explanation: The main purpose of cytokinesis in mitosis is to physically divide the cytoplasm of a single cell into two separate daughter cells, effectively completing the cell division process by ensuring each new cell receives a complete set of organelles and genetic material after the nucleus has divided during mitosis.

text: An animal which is active during the day is known as
Evidence for evolution include the following except?
explanation:
A mutation is a change in DNA, the hereditary material of life. An organism's DNA affects how it looks, how it behaves, and its physiology.
So a change in an organism's DNA can cause changes in all aspects of its life.
Mutations are essential to evolution; they are the raw material of genetic variation.
